<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Config </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>



</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Extract array from config entry. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[Array]] <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> '''getArray''' config </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> config: [[Config]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <ext><name>pre</name><attr/><inner>_array = getArray (configFile >> "CfgVehicles" >> "Thing" >> "threat")</inner><close></pre></close></ext> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[configFile]], [[config/name]], [[configName]], [[count]], [[getText]], [[getNumber]], [[inheritsFrom]], [[isArray]], [[isClass]], [[isNumber]], [[isText]], [[select]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on Mar 28, 2014 - 07:52
<dt class="note">[[User:ffur2007slx2_5|ffur2007slx2_5]]<dd class="note">
(ArmA3 1.14) It's recommended to use [[BIS_fnc_GetCfgData]] or [[BIS_fnc_returnConfigEntry]] to get variable cfg data rather than conditioning via [[isNumber]], [[isText]], [[isArray]], [[getNumber]], [[getText]] and [[getArray]] combination.<br>
Traditional workaround:
<code>
_cfg = [[configFile]] >> "CfgVehicles" >> _SomeAddonClassName >> "DestructionEffects" >> "Smoke1" >> "type"
[[switch]] ( [[true]] ) [[do]]
{
	[[case]] ([[isNumber]] _cfg): {[[getNumber]] _cfg};
	[[case]] ([[isText]] _cfg): {[[getText]] _cfg};
	[[case]] ([[isArray]] _cfg): {[[getArray]] _cfg;};
	[[default]] { nil };
};
</code>
'''Recommended workaround:'''
<code>
([[configFile]] >> "CfgVehicles" >> _SomeAddonClassName >> "DestructionEffects" >> "Smoke1" >> "type") [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_GetCfgData]];
</code>
To return default value once entry was not found, we can use [[BIS_fnc_returnConfigEntry]] instead of [[BIS_fnc_GetCfgData]].
<code>
[([[configFile]] >> "CannonFire" >> "LightExp"),"lifeTime",0] [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_returnConfigEntry]];//0.5
</code>
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 12, 2018 - 19:48 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:demellion|demellion]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
There is special behaviour if you try to read a description.ext config entry [[Array]] that contains a [[Boolean]].<br>
Getting array in '''MP''' will result in [[Number]], while '''SP''' will return [[String]].
<code>// SP with false in array
[[getArray]] ([[missionConfigFile]] >> "someClass" >> "someArray") // -> "false"

// MP with false in array
[[getArray]] ([[missionConfigFile]] >> "someClass" >> "someArray") // -> 0</code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
